Type.Name: ItemFactory

TypeSignature.Value: public class ItemFactory : Gtk.Object, IWrapper, IDisposable

Type.ThreadSafetyStatement: Gtk# is thread aware, but not thread safe; See the Gtk# Thread Programming for details.

Docs.summary: A factory for menus.
If has been created by an item factory, returns the full path to it.
Docs.param: A .
Docs.returns: The full path to if it has been created by an item factory, otherwise. This value is owned by GTK+ and must not be modified or freed.

remarks.para: The full path of a is the concatenation of the factory path specified in with the path specified in the from which the was created.

Docs.summary: Obtains the item factory from which a was created.
Docs.param: A .
Docs.returns: The item factory from which was created, or .

Docs.summary: Obtains the which was passed to .
Docs.param: A .
Docs.returns: associated with the item factory from which was created, or if wasn't created by an item factory.

remarks.para: This data is available until the menu is popped down again.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void AddForeign (Gtk.Widget accel_widget, string full_path, Gtk.AccelGroup accel_group, uint keyval, Gdk.ModifierType modifiers);

Docs.summary: Installs an accelerator for in , that causes the activate event to be emitted it the accelerator is activated.
Docs.param: Widget to install an accelerator on.
The full path for the .
The accelerator group to install the accelerator in.
Key value of the accelerator.
Modifier combination of the acelerator.

remarks.para: This method can be used to make widgets participate in the accel saving/restoring functionality provided by and , even if they haven't been created by an item factory. The recommended API for this purpose are the and ; don't use in new code, since it is likely to be removed in the future.

The factory path of , a string of the form "name".

Docs.summary: Deletes the menu item which was created from by the given item factory.

MemberSignature.Value: public void CreateItem (Gtk.ItemFactoryEntry entry, IntPtr callback_data, uint callback_type);

Docs.summary: Creates an item for .
Docs.param: The to create an item for.
Data passed to the callback method of .
1 if the callback method of is of type , 2 if it is of type .

Docs.summary: Obtains the which corresponds to .
Docs.param: To be added: an object of type 'uint'
Docs.returns: To be added: an object of type 'Gtk.Widget'

Docs.summary: Obtains the menu item which corresponds to .
Docs.param: The path to the menu item.
Docs.returns: The menu item for the given path, or if doesn't lead to a menu item.

remarks.para: If the corresponding to is a menu item which opens a submenum, then the item is returned. If you are interested in the submenum, use instead.

Docs.summary: Deletes the menu item which was created for by the given item factory.

Docs.summary: Creates the menu items from the .

An array of s whose members must be of type .

Docs.summary: Obtains the which corresponds to .

remarks.para: If the corresponding to is a menu item which opens a submenu, then the submenu is returned. If you are interested in the menu item, use instead.

A delegate to be called when the object is destroyed and when the translation is changed again.

MemberSignature.Value: public void PopupWithData (IntPtr popup_data, Gtk.DestroyNotify destroy, uint x, uint y, uint mouse_button, uint time_);

Docs.summary: Pops up the menu constructed form the item factory at (, ).
Docs.param: Data available for callbacks while the menu is posted.
A to be called on when the menu is unposted.
The x position.
The y position.
The mouse button which was pressed to initiate the popup.
The time at which the activation event ocurred.

remarks.para: Callbacks can access the while the menu is posted via and .

The should be the mouse button pressed to initiate the menu popup. If the menu popup was initiated by something other than a mouse button press, such as a mouse button release or a keypress, should be 0.
The should be the time stamp of the event that initiated the popup. If such a event is not available, use instead.
The operation of the and the is the same as the and for .

MemberSignature.Value: public void Popup (uint x, uint y, uint mouse_button, uint time_);

Docs.summary: Pops up the menu constructed form the item factory at (, ).
Docs.param: The x position.
The y position.
The mouse button which was pressed to initiate the popup.
The time at which the activation event ocurred.

remarks.para: The should be the mouse button pressed to initiate the menu popup. If the menu popup was initiated by something other than a mouse button press, such as a mouse button release or a keypress, should be 0.
The should be the time stamp of the event that initiated the popup. If such a event is not available, use instead.
The operation of the and the is the same as the and for .
